Deak: ^D: "Hey buddy, nice skateboard shoes! Show me a kick flip!"
^Piece of shit, are you messing around with my mom?
sleep: ^I wish, buddy. Haha, just kidding! Whoa, just kidding.
^Your mom came over early this morning to plan your dad's birthday surprise -- I gotta drive this UHAUL all the way to Jersey City to pick it up!
flip: ^D: "Ouch... you gotta practice that more, kid."
^Don't worry, you'll get it right someday!
^...whoa, chill out! I mean I'll get your mom the game machine thingy
present: ^D: "You tell me! I don't know anything about nerd things.
^She said something about surprising your daddy.
^I guess it's chubby hubby's birthday tomorrow?
^Whoops, don't tell her I told you, k?
Dad: ^Is there a tension in the room?...
^"Just talked to Deak, that guy's an asshole."
wheres_mom: ^Dad turns around, with a crazy look.
^Don't ask me where that lying, cheating wh--
asshole: ^"Fucking dammit! These damn dishes! I just..."
crying: ^I saw your mother sneaking out of the house this morning.
^She was going to that ASSHOLE's house.
^I can't do this. I can't be around her right now.
Mom: ^Honey! You're home! Wait till you see the BIRTHDAY SURPRISE I've planned for your father.
^I don't care, Mom. Where's my new skateboard?
^Deak said something about a game machine?
machine: ^Deak told you?! That silly man. Good looks are wasted on him, anyways...
mad: ^Mad at me? What on earth could he mad about?
^He saw you sneaking out this morning.
tie: ^Of course not! It's wayyyyy bigger than that. Huge, actually. My my, sometimes I'm such a good gifter I impress myself.
skateboard: ^Honey...no one will like you if you talk that way. Anyways, it's not your birthday. Now run along...
sneak: ^Oh honey, you've got it all wrong. It's not that.
^I was going to Deak's to ask him to pick up your dad's birthday present for me
explain: ^I got your dad an arcade machine! Not just any machine, a First Edition Street Fighter, your dad's favorite! You don't know how hard it was to find a seller.
^Mom...he found out and he thinks you're having an affair.
expensive: ^Oh, I had to sell his favorite original First Edition Mrs Pac Man to pay for it. You don't think he'll be upset, do you?
thoughtful: ^Thank you, I agree. Sometimes I impress myself.
affair: ^HA! Me, an affair? A woman my age, honey you flatter me.
win: ^HA! Your dad's such a sensitive soul. All these crazy ideas. Let me go talk to him, it'll clear it all up. Now you go change into your birthday suit.
^That's not what that word means, Mom.
^...you're welcome for saving this family, everyone.
